company: U.S. Census Bureau and General Assembly
jobDescription: Participated in a team of 15 people consisting of full stack developers, UX designers, and data scientists to create Grant Guide, a single-page web app for under-resourced communities that simplifies finding and applying for environmental remediation grants.
Developed an advanced search feature for over 400 federal grants in Michigan for environmental remediation with multi-category selection, a funding amount slider, and fuzzy searching.
Collaborated with the UX designers to build most of the React components for the landing page, grants search page, and user dashboard page to ensure an intuitive user flow when using the application.
Communicated daily with the lead developer, program manager, and cross-functional teams using an agile workflow process.
Developed skills in computer science, software engineering, and full-stack development with over 460 hours of professional-led curriculum and created four projects such as:
Hoja: A sleek markdown note-taking application with autosaving and the ability to switch between raw and parsed markdown text. Allows the user to create notebooks to organize notes neatly.

Flixnet: A mock e-commerce site and movie database using a 3rd party movie API that lets users browse movies and add them to their cart for checkout. Users can track their past orders on the users' page.
Archival: A trading card collection organizer and reference tool using 3rd party data of over 60,000 records where users can organize their collections and see other users' collections.
Solitaire: A fun rendition of Solitaire with an easy-to-use interface using MVC development architecture and object-oriented programming to ensure separation of concerns in the code base.

Contributed to the Product Integrity team to ensure device safety and performance of the Pax and Pax Era vaporizers product lines, conducted root cause analysis on vaporizer device failures, and recommended hardware design improvements to cross-functional teams.
Implemented an inventory manager using Google Apps Script and Google Sheets to keep track of 200 lab chemicals going in and out, easing the material request process within the organization.
Wrote a parsing script using JavaScript and Node to extract lab data from over 100 pdfs of test results to output into a spreadsheet, making the data extraction process easier for the chemistry team.
Developed a prediction model of product performance to provide a baseline metric for engineering design changes.
